intro: Tulasnea gracillima, commonly known as the slender tulasne, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its delicate, hairy stems and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are ovate and often have a soft, velvety texture. Tulasnea gracillima is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and swampy areas.
